alert.note: Alert for Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 8:57PM EST until January 10 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... East Branch Brandywine Creek Below Downingtown affecting Chester County. For the Brandywine Creek...including Downingtown...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Branch Brandywine Creek below Downingtown. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Open adjacent land next to the creek floods. At 8.0 feet, Dowlin Forge Road begins to flood. At 9.0 feet, High water on the Brandywine sends backwater up Beaver Creek. Beaver Creek floods inundating parks and the Downingtown Little League fields. At 11.0 feet, Jefferson Avenue in Downingtown floods. Business Route 30 and Pennsylvania Avenue also flood. At 12.0 feet, Residential basements flood along Jefferson Avenue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM EST Tuesday was 9.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.2 feet on 07/25/2023. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (9 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Stg Time Date East Branch Bran Downingtown 7.0 9.4 Tue 8 pm 3.5 MSG 11.3 12am 1/10 &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 900 AM EST.
